Description: The size of a cache block, representing a contiguous, naturally aligned NAPOT range of memory
Constraints: Must be uniform throughout the system in the initial set of CMO extensions; represents a contiguous, naturally aligned power-of-two (NAPOT) range
Keywords: uniform, implementation-specific, cache block, size, NAPOT, power-of-two, shall

Description: The total storage size (in bytes or blocks) of the cache
Constraints: None explicitly stated (only "implementation-specific")

Description: The internal structure and arrangement of the cache (e.g., associativity, ways, sets)
Constraints: Implementation-defined; may vary across implementations

Description: The method provided by the execution environment for software to identify cache and block information
Constraints: Execution environment must provide such a means; not specified further

Description: Total capacity and internal organization (e.g., associativity, number of sets) of a cache
Constraints: None explicitly specified beyond being implementation-specific

Description: Whether the cache block size is uniform throughout the system
Constraints: In the initial set of CMO extensions, the cache block size shall be uniform

Description: Whether cache blocks are naturally aligned (e.g., byte-addressable, word-aligned, etc.)
Constraints: ['Described as "naturally aligned" in the text (implied, not explicitly optional)', 'In initial CMO extensions, alignment is fixed by block size (NAPOT)']

Description: How a cache block is identified (e.g., via physical address, tag, or other means)
Constraints: None explicitly stated (only "implementation-specific")

Description: Size of the CSR address space in bits
Constraints: Fixed at 12 bits (csr[11:0]), supporting up to 4096 CSRs

Description: Encoding of the lowest privilege level that can access the CSR
Constraints: Next two bits of CSR address (csr[9:8])

Description: Convention for encoding CSR read/write accessibility and minimum privilege level in CSR address bits
Constraints: Uses upper 4 bits (csr[11:8]) of the 12-bit CSR address; bits csr[11:10] encode read/write vs read-only; bits csr[9:8] encode minimum accessible privilege level.

Description: Maximum number of CSRs that can be encoded in the 12â€‘bit CSR address space
Constraints: Up to 4096 CSRs

Description: Encoding of read/write accessibility using top two CSR address bits (csr[11:10])
Constraints: Values 00, 01, or 10 indicate read/write; 11 indicates read-only

Description: Encoding of the lowest privilege level that can access a CSR using bits csr[9:8]
Constraints: Encodes minimum privilege level required for access

Description: Encoding of read and write accessibility of CSRs based on privilege level
Constraints: Uses upper 4 bits of CSR address; top two bits indicate read/write or read-only

Description: Encoding of read/write accessibility of CSRs based on privilege level
Constraints:
- 12-bit encoding space (csr[11:0]) for up to 4,096 CSRs
- csr[11:8] encode read/write accessibility based on privilege level
- csr[11:10] indicate read/write (00,01,10) or read-only (11) access
- csr[9:8] encode the lowest privilege level that can access the CSR

Description: Adherence to the conventional 12-bit encoding space and privilege-based accessibility mapping for CSRs
Constraints: Uses csr[11:8] for accessibility and privilege level encoding; csr[11:10] for R/W vs RO; csr[9:8] for minimum privilege level

Description: The actual number of Control and Status Registers implemented within the defined encoding space
Constraints: Maximum of 4,096 CSRs (12-bit encoding space)

Description: The size of the encoding space reserved for CSRs.
Constraints: 12-bit encoding space (up to 4,096 CSRs)

Description: How the upper 4 bits of the CSR address are used to encode read and write accessibility according to privilege level.
Constraints: csr[11:8] used for accessibility encoding

Description: The bits within the CSR address that indicate whether a register is read/write or read-only.
Constraints: csr[11:10] indicate read/write (00,01,10) or read-only (11)

Description: The bits within the CSR address that encode the lowest privilege level allowed to access the CSR.
Constraints: csr[9:8] encode lowest privilege level

Description: Encoding of CSR read and write accessibility
Constraints: Upper 4 bits of CSR address (csr[11:8])

Description: Encoding of CSR read-only accessibility
Constraints: Top two bits of CSR address (csr[11:10]) equal to 11

Description: Options for CSR read and write accessibility
